text: Which are the three primary .EVT files? (Choose all that apply.)
note: A .LOG file is periodically rewritten into an .EVT format in one of these folders. Some versions of Windows have additional EVT files, but these three are the primary ones.

text: .EVT files can be altered on a running system by conventional means.
What tool was developed by Arne Vidstrom?
note: WinZapper is a tool that was developed by Arne Vidstrom and is free for download.

text: In a Linux distribution, a console session will save all the executed commands to a file.
Disabling auditing when logged onto a session allows hackers to hide their activities from administrators.
_____________ specifies the location and file where the shell commands will be logged.
What is the name of the directory that is "nowhere"?
note: If you send any file to the /dev/null directory, you are sending it to nowhere. Taking advantage of this black hole in Linux, if we redirect HISTFILE to /dev/null/ guess what will happen? All the logged commands will be sent to nowhere to be written in a log file.

text: Where are .EVT files readable through?
note: These files are readable through the Event Viewer and are the main log files in Windows.

text: A completely empty file won’t be noticed by an administrator as a sign of a breach.
What is the major limitation of WinZapper?

answers.text: Only works on Win NT and 2000

note: The first and major limitation of this app is that it works only for Win NT and 2000. Microsoft has since prohibited the deletion a of single entry from the events.

text: WinZapper sometimes corrupts the event logs and makes them unstable, unreadable, and unusable.
_______safely, efficiently, and rapidly handles cleaning up tens of thousands of "usage tracks" and other remnants that most programs leave behind.
note: MRU-Blaster safely, efficiently, and rapidly handles cleaning up tens of thousands of "usage tracks" and other remnants that most programs leave behind.

text: Every console session on Linux is exactly the same as the others.
The default file that holds the history or shell is:
note: The default file that holds the history or shell is [~/ .bash_history]. This file can be deleted and it will be recreated after the next log in.

text: What action makes sure that data is overwritten and unrecoverable?
note: Shredding files is intended, like its real world equivalent, to make sure that data you are finished with is unrecoverable. When a file is deleted, it is commonly dereferenced in the file system table but the contents are otherwise left untouched until the operating system writes over the space with a new file. To get around this, file shredding utilities overwrite the area with new data.

text: A term that refers to privacy features in web browsers is:
note: Privacy mode, or "private browsing" — sometimes informally referred to as "incognito mode" — is a term that refers to privacy features in some web browsers.

text: ___________ operates by allowing the user to choose between sets of anonymizing proxies, or "mix cascades," giving fine grain control over who the user trusts to route their traffic through.
note: The Java Anon Proxy operates by allowing the user to choose between sets of anonymizing proxies, or "mix cascades," giving fine grain control over who the user trusts to route their traffic through.

text: TOR stands for:
note: TOR stands for The Onion Router.

text: What is a motto you should implement for a best defense for covering your tracks?
note: Some of the best defenses, or we should say countermeasures, for covering your tracks is by implementing the Boy Scout motto: "be prepared."

text: What are somethings we can do to be more proactive?

answers.text: A) Hash integrity checks of log files

note: Things that we could do to be a little bit more proactive are: doing hash integrity checks of log files, and using a utility called Msyslog from core labs.

text: A corruption in error logs will be indicated by smiley faces, periods, percent symbols, etc.
Why would hackers leave audit policies disabled even after they log off?

answers.text: To prevent administrators from discovering the breach

note: A hacker may leave the audit policies disabled to facilitate further access.
